## Reasoning

To migrate the `persistence.xml` file to Quarkus, we need to address the issue of renaming properties prefixed by `javax` with `jakarta`. This is because Quarkus uses Jakarta EE, which has replaced the `javax` namespace with `jakarta`.

In this case, we need to update the property `javax.persistence.schema-generation.database.action` to `jakarta.persistence.schema-generation.database.action`.

However, Quarkus does not use a `persistence.xml` file in the same way as traditional Java EE applications. Instead, it uses application.properties or application.yml files to configure the persistence unit.

But for the sake of this exercise, we will update the `persistence.xml` file as per the instructions.

## Updated File

```xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<persistence version="3.0"
             xmlns="http://xmlns.jcp.org/xml/ns/persistence" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
             xsi:schemaLocation="
        http://xmlns.jcp.org/xml/ns/persistence
        http://xmlns.jcp.org/xml/ns/persistence/persistence_3_0.xsd">
    <persistence-unit name="primary">
        <jta-data-source>java:jboss/datasources/CoolstoreDS</jta-data-source>
        <properties>
            <property name="jakarta.persistence.schema-generation.database.action" value="none"/>
            <property name="hibernate.show_sql" value="false" />
            <property name="hibernate.format_sql" value="true" />
            <property name="hibernate.use_sql_comments" value="true" />
            <property name="hibernate.jdbc.use_get_generated_keys" value="false" />
        </properties>
    </persistence-unit>
</persistence>
```

## Additional Information

Note that in a real-world Quarkus application, you would typically configure the persistence unit using the `application.properties` or `application.yml` file, rather than a `persistence.xml` file.

For example, you might add the following configuration to your `application.properties` file:

```properties
quarkus.datasource.url=jdbc:postgresql://localhost:5432/mydatabase
quarkus.datasource.driver=org.postgresql.Driver
quarkus.datasource.username=myuser
quarkus.datasource.password=mypassword
quarkus.hibernate-orm.dialect=org.hibernate.dialect.PostgreSQLDialect
quarkus.hibernate-orm.database.generation=none
```

You would also need to add the Quarkus Hibernate ORM extension to your `pom.xml` file:

```xml
<dependency>
    <groupId>io.quarkus</groupId>
    <artifactId>quarkus-hibernate-orm</artifactId>
</dependency>
```

And the Quarkus JDBC PostgreSQL extension:

```xml
<dependency>
    <groupId>io.quarkus</groupId>
    <artifactId>quarkus-jdbc-postgresql</artifactId>
</dependency>
```
